constituent: he, Nelson, column, going, line, pelt, branch, ten, needle, crotch, hook
heisigStory: Going . . . pelt. This kanji refers to the third person singular personal pronoun, generally in its masculine form.
koohiiStory1: What´s the main difference between a he and a she? The he has a column covered in a pelt... a penis. Badum-ching.
koohiiStory2: The ultimate he-man is the Neanderthal cave man. His club is as big as a pillar (column), and he wears a ragged pelt as his only clothing. To remember the column, imagine the cave man resting the club vertically like a column when not in use.
myStory: chữ bỉ. kẻ khác, người kia. bộ da (bì) đi chậm
words: (uk) there, over there, that place, (X) (col) genitals
one thing or another, this and that, this or that
